byline.original: By DIONNE SEARCEY and JAIME YAYA BARRY

abstract: Violent protests in Gabon, sparked by political opposition's claims that recent election was fraudulent, leave one person dead; vote that returned incumbent president Ali Bongo Ondimba to office was largely peaceful, but opposition candidate Jean Ping and international observers noted irregularities.
lead_paragraph: Security forces in the West African nation clashed with opposition supporters after the declaration of a second term for President Ali Bongo Ondimba.
snippet: Security forces in the West African nation clashed with opposition supporters after the declaration of a second term for President Ali Bongo Ondimba....

headline.main: Violence After Gabon Elections Leaves One Dead
headline.print_headline: Violence Surges in Gabon Over Election Results
